article: Several years ago, we moved into the apartment where we live now. When my friends helped me move in, the downstairs neighbors began to _ about the noise. I could do _ about it. After all, noises are unavoidable .How can anyone move in _ . Still _ ,the complaints continued on a daily basis--well after the first day. We walked "too loudly"down the stairs, we laughed too often, we opened and closed the door too many times...They had many _ to complain. Nobody can stand the endless complaints and quarrels. I soon learned that they had driven off the last few families who lived above them by the same way. So I had the information I needed and I tried to _ very situation carefully. I tried to walk in _ to avoid any possible noises. Whenever they called _ came to the door with a complaint, no matter how unreasonable, I simply listened. From their confused expressions, I could imagine that they had never expected to get a _ attitude from me. Of course, it was hard to keep calm but my sister and I _ . I told my sister that we were going to be pleasant and _ them to change their attitude to neighbors. I explained to her that they probably felt _ in their lives because they are common people. _ , they were always looking for a _ to show their power so that nobody could look down upon them. I continued smiling and greeting them as I saw them, much to their _ .On more than one occasion , I ended up _ them. They thanked me before they left. Unexpectedly, the next time I saw them, they all smiled and _ friendly. We had a short but pleasant _ . Ever since then, they've been very pleasant neighbors, and we've become good _ .
